title: Hey Ugly
features: Who is Ugly? Ugly never seemed to fit in. Ugly felt she was ugly, and because she believed it, it was true. One kind word changed everything, and Ugly realized she was Pretty all along.
description: Pretty is a beautiful as pretty feels!

HEY UGLY demonstrates the mind-set of a girl who thinks she's ugly versus the girl who knows she's pretty. Hey Ugly acknowledges childhood teasing attributed to bullying and the lasting impression towards self-esteem. This story is intended to raise awareness and identify the role manipulation plays on a child's thought process, as a victim of bullying.
Who is Ugly? Ugly never seemed to fit in. Ugly felt she was ugly, and because she believed it, it was true. One kind word changed everything, and Ugly realized she was Pretty all along.

Motivational Speaker,Advocate, and Author Alicia J. Turner is dedicated to being the leadingvoice for all children. She speaks with experience and authority onmatters that involve children, yesterday, today and tomorrow. She has developed aunique approach of presenting sensitive topics in a thought-provoking way, thattransforms audiences with lessons that shift mindsets. Alicia speakscandidly about being specific when talking to children, with emphasis onplanting seeds.  Alicia creates herstories based on real life topics that are relevant to both children andadults, through education, positive literature and implementing a uniquemessage in each book she writes.
